book.synopsis: A fastidiously shaped series of lectures based on a chapter-by-chapter synopsis of the Spanish classic. Rejecting the common interpretation of Don Quixote as a warm satire, Nabokov perceives the work as a catalog of cruelty through which the gaunt knight passes. Edited and with a Preface by Fredson Bowers; photographs.
book.dimensions: Height: 0.61 Inches, Length: 7.96 Inches, Weight: 0.69 Pounds, Width: 5.8 Inches
